title: What on earth is wrong with this community?!
body:
https://i.imgur.com/sxyS23w.jpg[/img]

I barely ever even play this game! How did this happen? How quick to anger _is_ this community, exactly?! Heavens, friends, you lot need to calm the hell down if this isn't some kind of UI glitch.

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=Zero Shingetsu,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=BUPuNjtQ,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-04-27T13:48:12.754+0000)
>
> https://i.imgur.com/sxyS23w.jpg[/img]
> 
> I barely ever even play this game! How did this happen? How quick to anger _is_ this community, exactly?! Heavens, friends, you lot need to calm the hell down if this isn&#039;t some kind of UI glitch.

Anonymity is the pass given to those who choose to be a douche. Tells alot about the current crop of human beings gaming today.

It’s not just gamers, it’s humans in general. Put them in a public setting, they’ll be cordial. Take away the setting and give them anonymity with no chance of reprocutions and suddenly a large portion of them turn into horrid people.

Generally I assume the majority of them live in fear in real life, some form of it anyways. Timid, insecure, etc.

for future note, it's repercussion ^^

tv is starting to change with people's mentality as well, but many times I ask from ludicrous things that happen (like the tide-pod thing), how can people be that stupid?

You forget the return of the "condom snorting" challenge. Up through the nose, through the sinuses, out the mouth and floss. It came by once and people died of suffocation getting the condom stuck in thier throat. 

And then a year or two later, it makes a COMEBACK for a second round.

...At least it wasn't a cumback
(I'll see myself out)

Actually the tide pod thing was blown of proportion and misrepresented. Only approximately 80 or so out of the 11,000 cases were teenagers. The vast majority were either over 60 with some form of demetia, or children under 6 who just didn't know better. 

But that's what happens when you listen the mainstream media that will just sensationalize stories to sell ad space.

who listens to the media anymore?  the internet is always a week or more ahead of them and it's way easier to spread "information"  XD

though I am curious as to where you got your numbers from
Not gonna lie, I was typing on my phone and auto correct wouldn't give it to me, so I said fuck it.. lol (the spelling)
I agree and have expressed similar opinions in other posts. Good point!

> [{quoted}](name=Härd Stuck,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=BUPuNjtQ,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-04-27T14:46:40.539+0000)
>
> It’s not just gamers, it’s humans in general. Put them in a public setting, they’ll be cordial. Take away the setting and give them anonymity with no chance of reprocutions and suddenly a large portion of them turn into horrid people.
> 
> Generally I assume the majority of them live in fear in real life, some form of it anyways. Timid, insecure, etc.

Yeah, you're right. I was just keeping it to the game but the current society we have today has created this over time because society basically took away three important things...

Integrity
Discipline

And the most important is Accountability.

You take those away and stop teaching it and eventually it becomes todays society.

It's only going to get worse.
anonymous or not if someone starts yelling at me irl that i suck or in game im gonna react the same either way

> [{quoted}](name=Z3DsZ3D,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=BUPuNjtQ,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2018-05-03T13:20:12.214+0000)
>
> anonymous or not if someone starts yelling at me irl that i suck or in game im gonna react the same either way

Hey I'm with you but the fact is being anonymous makes people fearless. Most would never do this face to face because they would probably get the shit kicked out of them.

80%of the community is inactive each month
15% dont play enough games
2%are mildly toxic in chat or refuse to cooperate
3% non toxic people with enough games to get many honors
84% of statistics are made up on the spot

> [{quoted}](name=Ayzev,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=BUPuNjtQ,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2018-04-27T16:18:29.091+0000)
>
> 84% of statistics are made up on the spot

100% of people, DIE.
also
Less than 40% is not  alcohol
More than 60% of my liver, is damaged.
Marriage caused 100% of divorces
and 15.9% are made up ahead of time.
This is so bs lolololololol
Alternatively, you could also conclude that there are fewer instances for which the honour would be given.

> [{quoted}](name=FilDaFunk,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=BUPuNjtQ,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-04-27T14:45:54.631+0000)
>
> Alternatively, you could also conclude that there are fewer instances for which the honour would be given.

You could, but remember, I rarely play this game. If the honor just isn't handed out as often as others, statistically, someone who plays for a couple days at a time every few months shouldn't be getting over 600% of this particular honor more than other players get it.
I've always assumed it meant that you get that many more than the average player per game, not total.
Well, don't forget the tilt factor.
I think it's based on the number of games you play, not necessarily based on time.
i get similar percentages cause i rage a lot in discord about getting rekted by enemy champs so they ironically vote me till proof

There is a convention which started in korea where the "staying cool" honor is given to the worst player on the team. With the old honor system honor would only be given to "bad" players so those on that server with honor ribbons were "known to be bad". They were used as a vote of no confidence.
LOL. That's actually kind of clever. Ironically, it would fit many of my performances. Maybe I'm just really bad?
I get those all the time and I'm still dishonored and toxic I guess.
Not a glitch - honor is theoretically normally distributed (like a bell curve) and you just so happen to be towards the top of that curve.

Really?
Poisson seems a much better fit.

Eh, it really would depend on how you look at it - since the average number of honors a player gets is constantly changing (looking at the average across all League players) and that average can take on any value, it’s more a continuous variable than a discrete variable.

In small samples the continuous variable of average number of honors may very well appear discrete though. Regardless both distributions would theoretically be descriptive of the statistics depending on whether you use the discrete or continuous methods of measuring honors.

That all being said, it was more an attempt to explain the apparent discrepancy here - not to actually perform statistical analysis :P
Haha, congrats, you're officially the nicest guy on the rift :P
What the actual fk is that statistic
Most people just hit the middle honor. Not many people actually think about what honor to press.

Most people get honored for GG or the other one. It's just easier. Not saying this community isn't toxic, obviously it's enough to kill Deadpool from the sheer toxicity, but that's why it's that high most likely.
Oh yes and RIOT is perfect at making sure YOU get banned for not being toxic yet getting reported while the toxic guy screaming at you gets to keep playing. Makes the game fuuuuun!
How do you get your tilt proof honors? All I get are gg <3s.
I almost always invite people for GG because I see the thing so much I want to click the quickest option, other people might do the same.

And then there's me :)

https://imgur.com/4jIQkjs

I feel like the system is calculating every account in the game, including the massive number of smurf/unused accounts that are still just lying around.  I have around 10 accounts that I don't use for a variety of reasons.  Since the new honor system I have only played a couple games on them, getting maybe 10 honors.  Thus just in comparison to those if I get 1 honor on my main account I am already getting as many honors as the average player.

If you consider the number of people who played two or three games of league before deciding the game wasn't for them, the vast number of smurfs, and the players who left pre-honor system change it really isn't surprising to think that even a few honors puts you far ahead of the "average" player.

Now perhaps Riot's calculations account for said accounts and the community really is just that bad, idk.  However if they didn't it easily explains the numbers people get.
I just reached lvl 2 of the honour system :p

Nj reforming :D
Unless you meant 3...
I get those like 5 times a day lmao.
Well, it's not so much that I'm surprised I got a key fragment. It's more the 647% number that blew my mind.

> [{quoted}](name=Zero Shingetsu,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=BUPuNjtQ,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2018-04-27T16:55:41.889+0000)
>
> Well, it's not so much that I'm surprised I got a key fragment. It's more the 647% number that blew my mind.

Still the same for me.

it isnt so much that everyone is toxic as it is that most people arent specifically tilt proof all the time  as well as the fact that you only get 1 honor every game and usually people honor someone for either great shot calling or fun to play with
hm my record was 89%. i got 6 honors at that day...

People say the game is the worst it's ever been. Personally, I think the game itself is fine - the community is the worst it's ever been.

I lose way more games because my team won't stop flaming each other or because my team can't draft a composition than the enemy team getting a bunch of busted champions.
I'm toxic as fk in game most times, and I still get the "Your % more honorable than the average opponent"... now that makes me question the community.

You'd need around 40-60 honors before key fragment trigger to get that message.
[Edit] When you consider the maximum honor you can get per game is 4, you'd need to play at least 10-15 games while also getting honor from all your teammates.
My guess is you haven't received a key fragment for awhile since you haven't been playing the game much, so you accumulated a lot of honor with out getting a key fragment drop (which is based on time, the amount of fragments is based on honor level).
